events.message: The claimant reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th, requesting to initiate the insurance claim process for damages sustained.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under 'Auto Accident' after verifying that the incident involved a car collision on a public road.
An agent specializing in auto insurance claims has been assigned to manage and expedite the investigation and settlement procedures.
The claimant received confirmation that the insurance company officially acknowledges processing the vehicle accident claim.
The insurer requested detailed photographs of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with the claim investigation.
The claimant submitted all required documents including the police report, detailed images of the car damage, and mechanic’s repair estimates.
The claims investigation team has started reviewing the submitted documents and is contacting involved parties to verify the details of the collision.
The investigation into the auto accident claim has been finished, confirming the extent of damages and liability from the accident.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount based on the repair estimates and policy coverage limits for the vehicle damage sustained in the accident.
The claimant expressed dissatisfaction with the proposed settlement amount, requesting a re-evaluation of the repair cost estimates.
Due to the customer’s feedback, the claim has been escalated to a senior claims adjuster for further review and re-assessment.
Following re-assessment, the claim has been approved with an updated settlement offer that reflects the higher repair costs.
The approved settlement amount has been paid out to the claimant to cover the vehicle repairs related to the auto accident claim.
The vehicle accident insurance claim has been officially closed following successful settlement payment and confirmation from the claimant.
